Name: A modern interface redesign for America's open legal research platform
Meta Title: CourtListener: Modern Legal Research Platform Redesign | Magnet
Meta Description: See how Magnet transformed CourtListener's legal research platform with an end-to-end UI/UX redesign, improving user engagement through modern frontend development.
Assignment:
CourtListener, operated by the Free Law Project, approached Magnet to modernize their legal research platform serving millions of legal opinions across 421 jurisdictions. The challenge was to completely reimagine the user experience while maintaining the robust functionality that lawyers, journalists, academics, and researchers rely on daily.

CourtListener's platform needed a comprehensive overhaul to improve user engagement and research efficiency. The existing interface struggled to effectively present their vast database of legal opinions, oral arguments, and precedent analysis tools. Our objective was to redesign the entire platform interface while implementing a modern, high-performance frontend that could handle complex search queries and data visualization at scale.
Scope:
• UI/UX redesign
  • Frontend development
  • Information architecture
Approach:
Our team began with an extensive discovery phase, analyzing user behavior patterns and conducting stakeholder interviews to understand the diverse needs of CourtListener's user base. We mapped out complex user journeys for different personas including legal professionals, journalists, and researchers.

The design process focused on:

  • Streamlining the search interface for efficient legal research
  • Developing intuitive navigation patterns for millions of documents
  • Creating clear visual hierarchies for complex legal data
  • Optimizing precedent network visualizations
  • Improving mobile accessibility for on-the-go research
Implementation:
We executed the frontend overhaul using a component-based architecture that prioritized performance and accessibility. The implementation focused on:

  • Building a responsive design system that scaled across devices
  • Optimizing search result delivery through intelligent caching
  • Implementing real-time updates using HTMX for seamless user experience
  • Creating fluid transitions for complex data visualizations
  • Developing mobile-first interfaces for core functionality
  • Integrating advanced filtering and sorting capabilities
  • Optimizing API response handling for large result sets
Outcome:
The redesigned platform has transformed CourtListener's ability to serve its mission of open legal research:

  • 20% increase in average session duration
  • 40% faster average page load times
  • Enhanced accessibility compliance
  • Improved user satisfaction among legal professionals and researchers
Expertise: design-systems; ui-ux-design; analytics

Name: A premium digital presence for Cincinnati's premier BMW M-series specialists
Meta Title: Enthusiast Auto Group: Digital Transformation Case Study | Modern Website Design for Luxury Auto Specialists
Meta Description: Discover how we transformed Enthusiast Auto Group's digital presence with a sophisticated website redesign that reflects their expertise in premium BMW M-series vehicles and enhanced their customer experience.
Assignment: Enthusiast Auto Group (EAG), renowned for their unparalleled expertise in BMW M-series vehicles, sought to elevate their digital presence to match the premium nature of their services. As Cincinnati's leading specialist in rare and collectible BMW M vehicles, they needed a website that would not only showcase their inventory but also communicate their deep technical expertise and commitment to excellence. The existing website failed to capture the sophistication of their brand and the exceptional quality of their restoration and service work.
Scope:
• Brand strategy refinement
  • User experience design
  • Inventory management system
  • Full-stack development
Approach: Our team began by immersing ourselves in EAG's world, spending time at their facility to understand their meticulous approach to vehicle restoration and sales. We conducted extensive interviews with their master technicians, sales team, and long-time clients to grasp the full spectrum of user needs. This research revealed that potential buyers weren't just looking for vehicles – they were seeking assurance of authenticity, detailed documentation, and evidence of EAG's renowned attention to detail.
Implementation: We developed a comprehensive digital strategy that would mirror the precision and excellence found in every aspect of EAG's physical operations. Our design approach focused on creating an interface that would feel as refined and purposeful as the vehicles themselves, with careful attention to typography, spacing, and interaction design that echoed BMW's own design philosophy.
Outcome:
Since launch, the new website has delivered remarkable results:

  • 47% increase in qualified leads
  • 35% increase in average time spent on vehicle detail pages
  • 68% improvement in mobile user engagement
  • 52% reduction in bounce rate

‍

Name: An electrifying new brand and website for a cutting-edge electrical automotive company
Meta Title: Voltic: New Brand & Site for Electric Auto Co. | Magnet
Meta Description: An electrifying new brand and website for a cutting-edge electrical automotive company
Assignment: Voltic, a division of a larger, NASDAQ-traded manufacturer organization, tasked our team at Magnet with a rebrand to keep pace with the electrification and modernization trends sweeping the automotive industry. The outdated brand imagery didn't resonate with the modern, tech-savvy audience nor did it reflect the innovative electrical solutions Voltic provided. Our objective was to overhaul the website with an electrifying and lively brand that was sure to capture this energized audience.
Scope:
• UI/UX Design
  • Branding
  • Web Development
Approach:
In aligning with Voltic's desire for a modern and high-contrast design, we undertook a comprehensive study of the current electrification trends in the automotive industry. From there, we performed the following:

  • Analyzed competitors for design and user interface
  • Mapped out a color palette, typography, and imagery
  • Ensuring the new brand would reflect modernity, electrification, and the dynamic nature of the automotive sector
  • Authoritative copywriting, friendly while retaining a professional tone
Implementation: Our dev team utilized Webflow for its rapid deployment capability and its feature-rich environment for creating transitional animations. We developed a design that was modern, engaging, and reflective of the automotive industry's electrification trend. The typography was chosen to be dynamic and the color contrasts were sharp to evoke a sense of modernity and innovation.
Outcome: The rebranded website has successfully positioned Voltic as a contemporary and forward-thinking entity in the electrical manufacturing arena. The design tonality now resonates well with the modern automotive industry, reflecting the electrification and dynamic changes happening within this sector. The new design not only repositions Voltic's brand identity, but also enhances user engagement through its modern aesthetic and dynamic design elements.
Expertise: ui-ux-design; nocode-development; brand-strategy

Name: An artistic therapy brand and web application for processing and integrating emotions
Meta Title: Process Quickly - Therapy App and Brand Development | Magnet
Meta Description: Learn how Magnet helped Process Quickly build a user-friendly web app that streamlined their services.
Assignment: Process Quickly, a startup founded by a New York-based therapist, approached Magnet to create a brand and web application that could provide users with a personalized and therapeutic experience using cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT). The challenge was to design and build a web application that could provide users with an engaging and interactive experience while being easy to use.
Scope:
• Research and development
  • Wireframes
  • Storyboards
  • UI/UX design
  • Graphic design
  • Branding
  • Full-stack development
Approach:
Magnet's approach to the project was comprehensive and methodical, with a focus on understanding the client's needs and goals to create a web application that could meet those requirements. The initial phase involved an extensive discovery process to understand the client's vision and goals for the web application, which included identifying the target audience and gaining a clear understanding of their needs and preferences.

In addition, market research was conducted to identify the competition and understand the existing CBT-based therapy solutions available in the market. This research was used to create wireframes and user flows to plan out the user journey and create a user-friendly interface. A content strategy was developed with the goal of providing informative and engaging content to users. An SEO audit was also conducted to ensure that the website could be easily discovered by potential users on search engines. The project was guided by a strategic plan that outlined the key milestones, timelines, and resources required for successful completion. Lastly, a branding sprint was conducted to identify user personas and map out the appropriate strategy.
Implementation:
Upon completion of the planning and design stages, Magnet transitioned to the implementation phase. This involved creating content that was both engaging and informative, resonating with the target audience and addressing their unique needs and pain points. They also developed mood boards to establish the visual language and design elements that would align with the brand and appeal to the target audience. Another key aspect was the creation of storyboards to map out the user journey and ensure a seamless and engaging user experience.

The implementation phase also encompassed the design of a user-friendly interface that incorporated the essential features and functionalities to deliver a personalized and therapeutic experience to users. Custom graphics and illustrations were created that aligned with the brand and resonated with the target audience. The process also involved the incorporation of motion design elements to enhance user engagement and interactivity. Lastly, Magnet implemented a scalable design system that could be easily maintained in the future.
Outcome: The new web application created by Magnet successfully helped Process Quickly achieve their goals of providing a unique and interactive CBT-based therapy experience to users. The website received positive feedback from users, resulting in an increase in customer retention and sales. The website also improved organic search engine ranking, resulting in an increase in traffic and leads. Overall, the new web application successfully addressed the client's challenges and exceeded their expectations.
Expertise: copywriting; digital-strategy; full-stack-engineering; ui-ux-design; brand-strategy

Name: An exciting visual experience with integrated memberships for a startup BJJ gym
Meta Title: Bendu by Magnet
Assignment: Bendu Academy, a startup Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) gym, needed a robust and engaging website that would not only showcase their services but also integrate a comprehensive membership system. The challenge was to create a platform that would attract new students, provide valuable information to existing members, and streamline the membership management process for the gym's staff.
Scope:
• UI/UX Design
  • Webflow Development
  • Membership System Integration
  • Content Strategy
  • SEO Optimization
  • Mobile Responsiveness
Approach:
Our team began by conducting in-depth research into the BJJ and martial arts industry, focusing on the unique needs of both beginners and experienced practitioners. We aimed to create a website that would not only serve as a marketing tool but also as a valuable resource for the Bendu Academy community.

Key aspects of our approach included:

  1. Designing an intuitive and visually appealing interface that reflected Bendu Academy's brand and the dynamic nature of BJJ.
  2. Developing a comprehensive content strategy to showcase the academy's classes, instructors, and philosophy.
  3. Implementing a user-friendly membership system that would allow for easy sign-ups, renewals, and account management.
  4. Ensuring the website was fully responsive and optimized for mobile devices, catering to the on-the-go nature of many martial arts enthusiasts.
  5. Incorporating SEO best practices to improve the academy's visibility in local search results.
Implementation:
We chose Webflow as our development platform due to its flexibility, ease of use, and robust content management capabilities. This allowed us to create a custom, high-performance website without compromising on design or functionality. Key implementation aspects included:

  • Utilizing Webflow's CMS to create dynamic pages for classes, instructors, and blog posts, allowing for easy content updates by the Bendu Academy team.
  • Integrating a third-party membership management system (Memberstack) seamlessly with Webflow to handle user accounts, subscriptions, and payments.
  • Implementing a class schedule feature that allows members to view and sign up for classes directly through the website.
  • Creating a members-only area where registered users can access exclusive content, such as technique videos and training resources.
  • Designing and implementing a responsive navigation system that provides easy access to key information on both desktop and mobile devices.
  • Optimizing page load times through efficient asset management and leveraging Webflow's built-in performance features.
  • Implementing structured data markup to enhance search engine visibility and improve local SEO performance.

Throughout the development process, we maintained close communication with the Bendu Academy team, conducting regular reviews and incorporating feedback to ensure the website met their specific needs and reflected their vision for the academy.
Outcome:
The launch of Bendu Academy's new website has significantly boosted their online presence and operational efficiency. Key achievements include:

  • A 550% increase in new membership inquiries within the first three months of launch.
  • A 200% reduction in administrative time spent on membership management.
  • A 95% satisfaction rate among existing members regarding the new online resources and class booking system.
  • A 60% increase in organic search traffic, with improved rankings for local BJJ-related keywords.
Expertise: nocode-development; on-site-seo; off-site-seo; local-seo; technical-seo

Name: A creative expression for a full-service franchise and retail marketing agency
Meta Title: Brandience - Marketing Agency Website Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: Learn how Magnet designed an engaging, brand-centric site for Brandience. Let us help you make a strong impression!
Assignment: Brandience, a Cincinnati-based full-service marketing agency specializing in franchise companies, restaurants, and retail, sought a fresh and engaging website that would effectively convey their brand personality and showcase their expertise. With a client roster that includes prominent names like AAA, Papa Johns, and Tropical Smoothie Cafe, it was essential that their website made a strong and lasting impression on potential clients.
Scope:
• UI/UX Design
  • Jamstack Development
  • SEO/SEM Services
Approach:
Our team kicked off the project by conducting thorough research on Brandience's industry, competitors, and target audience. We visited their newly designed offices, which showcased their bright brand colors and energetic atmosphere, to gain a deeper understanding of their company culture and values.

Using the insights gained from our research, we developed a creative UI/UX design that incorporated bold, animating shapes and vibrant colors, mirroring the lively impression clients experience when visiting Brandience's offices. We also focused on creating a user-friendly and intuitive navigation structure that would enable potential clients to quickly access relevant information and services.
Implementation:
During the implementation phase, our team collaborated closely with Brian, Tim, and Desi from Brandience to ensure the project was progressing according to their vision and requirements. We utilized modern web development technologies, such as HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript, to create a responsive, fast-loading, and visually impactful website.

To optimize the website's performance, we implemented various optimization techniques, such as image compression, minification of CSS and JavaScript files, and browser caching. Additionally, we followed best practices in SEO to ensure the website ranked well in search engine results and attracted organic traffic.

Throughout the project, we maintained open lines of communication with Brandience's team, discussing progress, addressing concerns, and incorporating feedback to ensure the final website accurately reflected their brand identity and met their business objectives.
Outcome: The result was a vibrant and dynamic website that effectively communicated Brandience's unique brand identity and showcased their expertise in full-service marketing for franchise companies, restaurants, and retail. The website's visually striking design, seamless user experience, and compelling content have not only captured the attention of potential clients but also reinforced Brandience's position as a leading marketing agency in their niche. The collaboration with Brandience's team made the project a truly enjoyable and rewarding experience for all parties involved.
Expertise: jamstack; ui-ux-design; technical-seo; digital-strategy; copywriting; brand-strategy

Name: Modernizing a Midwestern Engineering Leader’s Website
Meta Title: BSI Engineering - Website Redesign Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: See how Magnet redesigned a more streamlined and user-friendly website for BSI Engineering.
Assignment: BSI Engineering, an employee-owned engineering firm serving clients in chemicals, pharmaceuticals, food and beverage, and renewable fuels, partnered with Magnet to completely redesign their website. With a strong reputation built over two decades and a growing portfolio of work, BSI needed a site that better reflected their depth, culture, and technical sophistication — and served as a stronger lead generation platform for their business development team.
Scope:
• Website strategy and content planning
  • UI/UX design
  • Webflow development
  • On-page SEO
Approach:
We started with stakeholder interviews and a deep dive into BSI’s brand positioning. Their leadership team emphasized their unique strengths: employee ownership, cross-disciplinary expertise, and a Midwest-based team that delivers with care. From there, we mapped out a content strategy to better tell that story — one that balanced technical credibility with approachability.

We also conducted a comparative audit of other engineering firms to identify opportunities to stand apart — especially in clarity, usability, and visual polish.
Implementation:
We designed and developed the new site using Webflow, giving BSI a scalable, easy-to-manage platform moving forward. Key improvements included:

  • A refined, modern UI that reflects BSI’s technical professionalism and approachable team culture
  • A flexible CMS architecture that allows BSI’s marketing team to create, update, and manage project case studies, job openings, and team pages with ease
  • Improved page structure and internal linking to better guide users through services and industry expertise
  • Optimized performance across all devices, ensuring fast load times and smooth navigation
  • Integrated analytics and tracking to support ongoing marketing insights
Outcome: The new site launched as a sharp, modern platform that better represents BSI’s capabilities and culture. User engagement improved significantly, bounce rates dropped, and the internal team has been able to easily maintain and update the site without developer support. With a scalable CMS, cleaner navigation, and an elevated brand presence, BSI is now positioned online the same way they operate in the field: with precision, pride, and confidence.

Name: Seamless automotive ecommerce for a Nasdaq traded corporation
Meta Title: Aftermarket Truck Parts - eCommerce Case Study | Magnet

Assignment: Aftermarket Truck Parts, a subsidiary of CVG, was looking to make a significant impact on the automotive ecommerce market with their extensive range of truck parts. Magnet was ready to deliver a tailored solution that would drive success and customer satisfaction.

• Ecommerce Platform Development
  • Market Research
  • SEO and Content Planning
  • UI/UX Design
  • Full-Stack Development

We kicked off with an extensive discovery phase, conducting in-depth market research and analyzing industry trends to pinpoint opportunities for growth and differentiation. By engaging in deep discussions with the client, we gained a clear understanding of their product range and desired functionalities, ensuring our approach was tailored to their specific needs.
Implementation:
With a solid foundation in place, we focused on creating a visually appealing and intuitive user experience, incorporating a seamless navigation system and efficient search capabilities. Our team designed and developed an ecommerce platform that catered to the needs of both casual and professional users, making it easy for customers to find, compare, and purchase the products they needed.

Throughout the development process, we paid close attention to SEO best practices and content planning, ensuring that the platform was optimized for search engines and attracted high-quality, targeted traffic.

The Aftermarket Truck Parts ecommerce platform is now live, providing an accessible and efficient online shopping experience for customers seeking quality truck parts. The fresh e-commerce platform substantially amplified Aftermarket Truck Parts' online visibility and accessibility.

In addition, we were able to swiftly rank the site within the top 10 for the targeted "Aftermarket Truck Parts" keyword. This transformation not only elevated the site's user experience but also firmly positioned Aftermarket Truck Parts as a dependable online retailer in the truck parts market. Name: A 200% ROI just 3 days after website relaunch
Meta Title: Commonwealth Inc. Website Redesign | Logistics & Warehousing Excellence
Meta Description: See how Magnet revamped Commonwealth Inc.’s website, enhancing user experience, SEO, and lead generation for a premier third-party logistics provider.
Assignment:
Commonwealth Inc., a trusted third-party logistics provider with over 35 years of experience, needed a website that reflected its reputation for reliability, efficiency, and industry expertise. With expansive warehousing solutions and multimodal transportation services, the company required a digital platform that would effectively communicate its capabilities while driving customer engagement and lead generation.

Magnet was entrusted with creating a high-performance website that would modernize Commonwealth’s online presence, enhance user experience, and improve visibility in the highly competitive logistics industry.
Scope:
• UI/UX Design
  • Custom Website Development
  • SEO & Content Strategy
  • Mobile Optimization
  • Lead Generation Optimization
Approach:
A logistics company’s website must be clear, intuitive, and action-driven. We developed a streamlined navigation structure that allows visitors to quickly access warehousing, transportation, and industry-specific solutions. Each service page was designed to showcase Commonwealth’s expertise with engaging visuals, detailed content, and clear calls to action.

With logistics being a highly competitive space, we developed an SEO-focused content strategy that emphasized Commonwealth’s differentiators—its 2 million square feet of premium warehousing, multimodal transportation options, and expertise across industries like aerospace, chemicals, and food & beverage.
Implementation:
By integrating strategic keywords, optimizing metadata, and structuring content for readability and engagement, we positioned Commonwealth as a top-tier player in third-party logistics.

Given the growing number of business decision-makers accessing websites via mobile devices, we implemented a mobile-first approach. The new site is fully responsive, ensuring seamless experiences across all screen sizes, from desktops to tablets and smartphones.

Understanding the importance of inclusivity, we designed the website to meet ADA and WCAG standards. Features like alt text for images, keyboard navigation, and high-contrast design elements ensure accessibility for all users.

A logistics website isn’t just an informational hub—it’s a sales tool. We implemented high-impact call-to-action (CTA) buttons throughout the site, integrated lead forms, and optimized the “Speak to Sales” feature to streamline the customer inquiry process.
Outcome:
The new website showcases Commonwealth as a leader in the logistics space, with a modern, professional design that reflects its expertise and trustworthiness.

With an SEO-optimized content strategy, the website now ranks for high-value keywords in warehousing, transportation, and industry-specific logistics solutions, driving increased organic traffic.

The streamlined navigation, clear service offerings, and conversion-driven layout have led to increased inquiries and engagement from businesses looking for logistics solutions.

‍
Expertise: analytics; content-management-systems; conversion-rate-optimization; copywriting

Name: Elevating Three Sixty Merchandise’s Digital Presence to Match Their Retail Expertise
Meta Title: Three Sixty Merchandise – Website Redesign & Development Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: See how Magnet redesigned and rebuilt Three Sixty Merchandise’s website to showcase their deep Kroger expertise and drive brand partner engagement.
Assignment: Three Sixty Merchandise, an employee-owned retail merchandising powerhouse specializing in helping brands succeed within Kroger stores, came to Magnet to modernize their website. Their previous digital presence didn’t capture their depth of expertise, strong industry relationships, or full-service approach to category management, space optimization, analytics, and retail execution. The goal: create a polished, strategically structured website that reflects their leadership in the Kroger ecosystem and acts as a powerful growth platform for brand partnerships.
Scope:
• Website strategy and content architecture
  • UX/UI design
  • Webflow development
  • On-page SEO
  • Performance optimization
  • Service detail pages and storytelling design
  • Analytics and lead tracking setup
Approach:
We started with in-depth workshops to uncover Three Sixty’s differentiators — from their proximity and relationships with Kroger’s leadership to their employee-ownership advantage. We audited competitor sites and retail service providers, identifying opportunities to present Three Sixty as the premier choice for brands looking to succeed at Kroger.

Our content strategy emphasized clarity and credibility, structuring the site so prospects could easily move from high-level capabilities into detailed service pages covering category management, space optimization, analytics, and execution. The design language blended corporate polish with retail energy, ensuring the brand felt both strategic and approachable.
Implementation:
We designed and developed the new site in Webflow, enabling the Three Sixty team to manage and update content without developer intervention. Key improvements included:

Outcome: The redesigned website positions Three Sixty Merchandise as the go-to partner for brands navigating Kroger’s competitive retail environment. The site now clearly communicates their expertise, services, and unique employee-ownership advantage, while giving prospects a frictionless path to connect. Early engagement metrics show visitors spending more time on key service pages and submitting more inquiries, turning the website into a strategic growth asset for the company.

Name: Building a comprehensive live streaming platform for a wildlife conservation organization
Meta Title: Explore Org - Streaming Platform Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: See how Magnet created a unique platform for Explore to stream live animal feeds, raising conservation awareness.
Assignment: Explore.org, a philanthropic mission funded by the Annenberg Foundation, sought to raise awareness of animals and endangered native tribes worldwide. They required a comprehensive platform that included microsites and proprietary software to stream live feeds of animals in their natural habitats. The objective was to capture live animal footage, process the video feeds through automated transformation scripts, and display them on the website for viewers to enjoy, all while raising awareness for conservation efforts.
Scope:
• Discovery and research
  • Systems architecture
  • Full-stack development
Approach:
We started by understanding Explore.org's mission and vision and the technical requirements necessary to create a powerful platform for live animal streaming. Based on this understanding, we designed a custom Python Django-based platform that would effectively address Explore.org's needs.

The platform's design focused on seamless video processing, enabling live feeds of animals in their natural habitats to be transformed and displayed for viewers to enjoy. We also developed multiple microsites to showcase various animal habitats and endangered native tribes, ensuring that the platform served as an educational and awareness-raising tool.
Implementation:
Over the course of several years, our team worked closely with Explore.org to build the comprehensive platform. We developed proprietary software for processing live animal video feeds and created multiple microsites to provide viewers with diverse content related to animal habitats and endangered native tribes.

Throughout the development process, we maintained open communication with Explore.org's team, incorporating feedback and ensuring that the platform met their expectations and requirements.
Outcome:
The result was a robust and comprehensive platform that allowed Explore.org to stream live animal feeds, raise awareness for conservation efforts, and educate viewers about endangered native tribes. The platform not only offered engaging and educational content for viewers but also supported Explore.org's philanthropic mission.

Our long-term collaboration with Explore.org and the provision of ongoing engineering services ensured the platform's continued success and optimal performance. The Python Django-based platform we built together has greatly contributed to Explore.org's efforts to promote conservation awareness and inspire action worldwide.
Expertise: full-stack-engineering; ui-ux-design

Name: A multi-league recreational sports platform for Gotham Soccer
Meta Title: Gotham Soccer - Sports League Platform Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: Discover how Magnet developed Gotham Soccer's robust league management platform. Let's innovate together!
Assignment: Gotham Soccer, a rapidly growing soccer league organization operating in multiple cities across the United States, needed a robust, scalable, and user-friendly web platform to manage their leagues, facilitate communication among players and organizers, and streamline the entire process from registration to scheduling and results tracking.
Scope:
• UI/UX Design
  • Full-Stack Development
  • Payments
  • SEO/SEM Services
Approach:
Our team began by conducting extensive research and analysis to understand the unique needs and pain points of Gotham Soccer's diverse user base. We leveraged industry best practices in UI/UX design, such as usability testing, user flows, and wireframing, to create a tailored interface that would resonate with the target audience.

Once we had a solid understanding of the user requirements, our team developed a detailed project plan, outlining the various features, functionalities, and milestones for each phase of the project. We chose a modern tech stack, including React for the front-end and Node.js for the back-end, to ensure a high-performance, scalable, and maintainable web platform.
Implementation:
Throughout the implementation process, our team worked closely with Gotham Soccer to ensure the platform met their specific requirements and exceeded their expectations. We utilized Agile development methodologies, including Scrum and Kanban, to facilitate rapid iteration and frequent communication, allowing for a high degree of flexibility and adaptability as the project progressed.

Our full-stack developers built custom APIs to handle complex data relationships, such as team rosters, schedules, and league standings, ensuring seamless interaction between the front-end and back-end systems. We also integrated third-party APIs, such as Google Maps, for geolocation services and Stripe for secure payment processing.

To optimize the platform's performance, our team implemented caching strategies, code-splitting, and server-side rendering techniques. We also ensured the platform was fully responsive and accessible across various devices and screen sizes, adhering to the latest web accessibility guidelines (WCAG 2.1).

Throughout the project, our team applied DevOps principles and utilized continuous integration and deployment pipelines to maintain a high-quality codebase and minimize downtime during updates.
Outcome: The result was a powerful, user-friendly, and scalable league management web platform that seamlessly integrated registration, scheduling, results tracking, and communication for players and organizers alike. With ongoing support and new feature development from our team, Gotham Soccer continues to grow and expand its reach across multiple cities in the United States.

Name: A franchise website platform for a professional services company
Meta Title: TruBlue House Care - Franchise Website Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: Explore how Magnet developed a captivating web presence for TruBlue House Care, elevating their brand with franchise web design. Maybe we can help you next!
Assignment: TruBlue Total House Care, a trusted national brand for home maintenance, needed a revitalized online presence to further resonate with local markets and reflect modern aesthetics. Our task was to overhaul the franchise website, infusing a fresh, modern look while elevating its functionality to ensure a seamless user experience. This transformation aimed not only to retain the brand’s national trust but to bolster its local outreach, paving the way for sustained growth.
Scope:
• CMS Development
  • Franchise Platform Development
  • SEO Audit
  • UI/UX Design
  • Graphic Design and Illustration
  • Full-Stack Development
  • Growth Marketing
Approach:
We decided to employ a Jamstack approach for the website overhaul. This allowed us to create a modern, functional website that provided flexibility for franchise owners while attracting new customers across the brand. As a thriving franchise with over 50 national locations, it was essential to communicate the brand values and services while allowing owners to customize their locations in a hassle-free way.

To ensure the website attracted the right audience, we conducted a comprehensive SEO audit. This helped us identify relevant keyword opportunities and understand various audience needs. Based on these insights, we created a sitemap, added new pages, and devised a page structure that informed and converted visitors.

Although TruBlue already had a brand identity and color scheme, our team expanded upon what was already working. We drew from existing elements to create custom icons, background motifs, and an expanded palette of colors. It was crucial for the brand elements to exude professionalism, trustworthiness, and cleanliness.

In line with the mission and values of TruBlue, we developed a clean, modern user interface (UI) design. This involved using fresh colors, ample white space, colorful photography, and tactful animation to enhance the user experience and create an inviting online presence for the brand.

‍
Implementation:
During the implementation phase, we focused on creating a robust platform that empowered franchise owners to manage their own profile pages, update their location information, and gather leads. To achieve this, we utilized the Jamstack architecture, which allowed us to build a platform that scaled efficiently, instead of simply creating a single website. Our goal was to develop an entire ecosystem that facilitated seamless management for TruBlue's franchise owners.

The backend of the platform was developed using Laravel, a PHP framework known for its performance and flexibility. This choice ensured that the platform could handle the complex needs of multiple franchises while maintaining speed and reliability.

We used Nuxt and VueJS to power the frontend, as these JavaScript frameworks enabled us to create a highly interactive and responsive user experience. This, in turn, provided franchise owners with an intuitive interface to manage their individual pages, making it easy for them to update their profiles and location information as needed.

To bring everything together, we implemented a headless CMS – Sanity. This choice allowed us to separate the content management from the frontend presentation, providing franchise owners with a streamlined content management experience. The headless CMS architecture enabled us to store and manage all content in a centralized location, while allowing each franchise owner to access and update their specific content seamlessly.
Outcome: The newly designed TruBlue website is not only easy to navigate, but it also drives traffic through previously untapped keywords, making it a valuable tool for franchise owners. Within three months of the site's launch, user numbers increased by 30%, pageviews saw a 58% uptick, and session duration grew by 9% compared to the previous year. The modern design, seamless functionality, and locally-focused strategy have all contributed to the flourishing of the TruBlue Total House Care brand on the local level.
Expertise: copywriting; ui-ux-design; jamstack; digital-strategy

Name: Annotations and assignment software for the humanities classroom
Meta Title: UCLA - Custom Software Development Case Study | Magnet
Meta Description: See how Magnet's custom software development for education improved UCLA's digital infrastructure and efficiency. Contact us to see how we can help you too!
Assignment: The University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) required a robust platform capable of melding advanced document management with Optical Character Recognition (OCR) processing and multi-threaded annotations. Our goal was to architect a custom solution built to perform at scale, ensuring swift, precise document handling amidst a multi-threaded annotation environment. This initiative was aimed at elevating UCLA's document management capabilities to new heights, fostering enhanced collaborative and analytical opportunities across the institution.
Scope:
• Document Management EDMS
  • Annotations Platform
  • UI/UX Design
  • Ongoing Support

‍
Approach: Our goal was to create a user-friendly and high-performance platform that could handle potentially hundreds or thousands of students annotating the same document simultaneously while maintaining an orderly and uncluttered interface. We focused on readability and accessibility across resolutions and point sizes for the type selection and color scheme. The platform's design had to accommodate both readability and writing functions, as teachers and students would spend a significant amount of time writing within the app.
Implementation:
The interface was built using a split-screen layout, with the source text on the left side of the screen and the annotations on the right. Filters and paragraph selection features were integrated to allow high levels of participation without excess visual clutter. Inline text transformation, auto-saving, and offline functionality were implemented to enhance the writing experience and improve user engagement.

Annotation activities were contained within assignments. Faculty members could add any number of tasks to each document added to an assignment, while a dashboard interface with due dates and color labeling allowed students to visually track their progress.

To address the challenge of handling hundreds of students and faculty members concurrently annotating and uploading documents, we employed a microservices architecture, allowing us to choose the best technologies and distribute the load across the app. Key technologies used included Tesseract OCR for interpreting scanned text, Elastic for search, Angular for the frontend, and an open-source EDMS document management system.

A significant challenge was developing a method for easily uploading, OCR scanning, MIME type sorting, and transforming any scanned or digital document type into semantic HTML, ready for annotating.

The platform was built using Python, Angular, HTML5, CSS, Terraform, Tesseract OCR, and other cutting-edge tools to create a seamless user experience.

‍
Outcome:
The custom platform we designed for UCLA successfully integrated advanced document management with OCR processing and multi-threaded annotations, enabling faculty and students to collaborate efficiently and at scale. The platform's user-friendly design and high-performance capabilities have made it an invaluable tool for the UCLA community, fostering enhanced engagement and learning experiences.

‍
Expertise: full-stack-engineering; digital-strategy; infrastructure-devops; ui-ux-design; performance-and-security

Name: A bespoke auction platform for a thoroughbred horse trading startup
Meta Title: Inglis Digital USA - Equestrian Online Auction Platform | Magnet
Meta Description: Uncover how Magnet designed a unique, equestrian-focused website for Wanamakers, driving online engagement. Contact us to see how we can help you next!
Assignment: Wanamaker’s, a prestigious thoroughbred horse auction house, sought to blend the thrill of live auctions with the digital ease of online bidding. Our mission was to engineer a cutting-edge bidding platform that encapsulated the essence of live auction excitement while introducing the convenience and accessibility of online interactions. This hybrid platform was envisioned to not only broaden Wanamaker's reach but to redefine the bidding experience for its discerning clientele.
Scope:
• UI/UX Design
  • Full-Stack Development
  • Payments
  • SEO/SEM
Approach:
We embarked on an immersive discovery phase to learn from international competitors and identify areas of improvement for creating a better user experience for buyers, sellers, and industry experts. The objective was to build a modern, dependable, and user-friendly platform with a robust content management system (CMS) and powerful real-time bidding software that would propel Wanamaker's to the forefront of the online horse auction industry.

The Wanamaker's brand is modern and refined, so the website design needed to reflect its sophistication while increasing its credibility as a newcomer to the market. We carefully chose the type selection and color scheme to ensure readability and convey the brand values that Wanamaker's embodies. The design was inspired by mid-century prestige, featuring tan orange with light cream leather, contrasted with a dark, classical navy.

‍
Implementation:
The main catalog page was designed with active filters, optional grid, list, and map views, and optimized for reader scannability. Horse buyers needed to track open and close times and prices with ease. The single horse listing page displayed all the vital information a buyer might need, weighted by importance—type, sex, breed, heritage, photos, videos, mapped location, clear description, pedigree information, and race history. Real-time bid information was displayed in a fixed panel to the right, allowing buyers to make informed value judgments on bids quickly.

For auction power users and consigners, we designed a quick modal shortlist of all the horses a buyer was watching, with the ability to bid inline on any page of the site. Interface elements were designed to be breathable, spacious, and communicative, countering the typical online auction experience of cramped, outdated UI with a calm, modest interface.

Email notifications played a critical role in the user experience. We hand-coded email templates to match the Wanamakers brand, ensuring they contained the right information needed for buyers and sellers without overwhelming them.

Building the auction platform from scratch was a considerable undertaking. We developed a custom Laravel, Nuxt, and Stripe platform for high-concurrency, low-latency bidding, setting a performance benchmark for the system of 10,000 active bidders within 100ms of each other with no discernible lag. Websockets was a foundational technology in meeting this metric, with bids updating near-instantaneously even at scale.

We modeled and tested highly complex bidding scenarios for months to ensure the Wanamakers platform would be flawless, balanced, and fair at all times. The platform was built using websockets on Laravel with a Nuxt JS frontend and Tailwind CSS for the UI elements.
Outcome: The Wanamaker's website and bidding platform was built and launched within a six-month production cycle, attracting more customers every month. Their first online auction took place in June 2020, where they successfully listed and sold prominent thoroughbred racing horses. The platform continues to gain momentum, solidifying Wanamaker's position in the online horse auction industry.
Expertise: full-stack-engineering; ui-ux-design; digital-strategy; ecommerce-platforms

  • Mobile App Development
  • Integration with Legacy Systems
Approach:
Our team began by conducting a comprehensive analysis of Windward Bank's existing systems, customer needs, and industry best practices. We focused on creating a digital platform that would not only meet current banking standards but also set new benchmarks for user experience and security in the financial sector.

Key aspects of our approach included:

  1. Designing an intuitive, responsive interface that would cater to both tech-savvy users and those transitioning from traditional banking.
  2. Implementing robust security measures, including multi-factor authentication and state-of-the-art encryption protocols.
  3. Developing a scalable architecture that could handle high-volume transactions and integrate seamlessly with existing banking infrastructure.
  4. Creating a mobile app that would provide full banking functionality on-the-go, aligning with the increasing trend of mobile banking.
  5. Ensuring compliance with all relevant financial regulations and security standards, including FDIC and DIF insurance requirements.
Implementation:
Our development team utilized a modern tech stack to build a high-performance, secure digital banking platform. We employed a microservices architecture to ensure scalability and ease of future upgrades. Key implementation aspects included:

  • Leveraging Webflow and Hubspotfor the frontend to create a dynamic and responsive user interface.
  • Integrating with third-party services for enhanced functionality.
  • Implementing a robust API layer to facilitate seamless communication between the frontend, backend, and third-party services.
  • Utilizing AWS for cloud hosting, ensuring high availability and scalability.
  • Implementing continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipelines to streamline updates and maintain code quality.

Throughout the development process, we maintained open lines of communication with Windward Bank's team, conducting regular sprint reviews and incorporating feedback to ensure the platform met their specific requirements and aligned with their brand vision.

‍
Outcome:
The launch of Windward Bank's digital platform has been a resounding success, positioning them at the forefront of digital banking innovation. Key achievements include:

  • A 500% increase in new account openings within the first month of launch.
  • A 95% customer satisfaction rate, based on post-launch surveys.
